title: RWDevCon 2016 Post-Mortem
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: We just had our second annual tutorial conference, RWDevCon 2016. Find out how it went! :]

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 308: Core Data to Online Service Synchronization
author: Aaron Douglas
overview: You (hopefully) love using Core Data in your apps but what’s the best way to pull data off the Internet and synchronize it with your app? In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to structure your Core Data calls into services which makes synchronization easier for both unit testing and implementation.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 307: Architecting for Multiple Platforms
author: Erik Kerber
overview: Developing for iOS used to be as straightforward as just targeting an iPhone, iPad, or (if you were feeling adventurous) both! In the past year, however, Apple has introduced a watch, a new Apple TV, and bigger iPads that can run your app in a multitude of size modes. You will learn how to create a single project that shares styling, frameworks, and code across a family of targets including iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, Apple Watch, and a Today Extension.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 306: MVVM in Practice
author: Eric Cerney
overview: Sick of giant view controllers? Not sure where to put your app’s business logic? Wanting to write tests but can’t for the life of you get started? Lucky for you, the Model-View-ViewModel pattern is the answer you’ve been looking for! In this session you’ll get hands on experience organizing your code into easy-to-understand testable components using MVVM.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 305: App Architecture
author: René Cacheaux
overview: Is your codebase resilient to change? Can you and your team build features and fix bugs swiftly and easily without inadvertently introducing regressions? In this tutorial, you’ll learn practical core architectural concepts while getting hands on experience writing flexible code. From encapsulating user story logic into asynchronous NSOperations to injecting dependencies, you’ll walk out of here architecting apps like a pro!

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 304: Swift and C Interoperability
author: Mic Pringle
overview: Swift’s type system encourages safety and forces us to write better code. However, this can be problematic when working with C. You may not see this as an immediate problem, since you’re coding in Swift, right? But what if your next project includes a legacy C codebase or open source C lib you need to wrap? This session will teach you how to safely work with C from Swift, what the obstacles and caveats are, and how wrap your C code so it’s far more Swift-y.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 302: Advanced LLDB and Console Debugging
author: Derek Selander
overview: With LLDB, you are a puppet master in a vast expanse of memory. Learn how to impress/scare your coworkers with your newfound debugging knowledge and gain insight into how Apple solves the same problems you’re up against.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 301: Advanced Auto Layout
author: Jerry Beers
overview: iPhone 4S, 5, 6, 6 Plus, iPad, and iPad Pro, oh my! With each cool new device Apple announces, it becomes more important to use Auto Layout in your apps. In this session, you’ll learn what’s going on behind the scenes with Auto Layout, and how to make layouts work with UIStackView and UIScrollView too.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 208: Xcode Tips & Tricks
author: Jack Wu
overview: Have you ever spent time traversing Xcode’s interface searching for that one file or feature you want? This session will introduce you to several Xcode tips including hotkeys, behaviors, code snippets, and more! Watch as Xcode does exactly what you want it to at the touch of a button, or even better — without touching anything at all.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 207: Xcode UI Testing
author: Ellen Shapiro
overview: In Xcode 7, Apple introduced the ability to UI test your application without any third-party dependencies using XCUI tests. Learn how to take advantage of the UI test recording feature, how to use accessibility features to verify your application works for your users as expected, and how to pass information into your test target even though it’s running in a totally separate process.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 206: 3D Touch
author: Ryan Nystrom
overview: Ever wanted to take your app to the next dimension? The latest iPhones now have support for capacitive touch, which can tell how hard you are pressing on the screen. New to iOS 9, the 3D Touch APIs let you add home screen shortcuts, peek and pop, and even your own custom gestures! This tutorial will teach you all about these new APIs and show you just how easy they are to add to your apps.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 205: How to Make Delightful UI
author: Richard Turton
overview: Add some personality to your apps by moving beyond the iOS standards and adding a pinch of surprise and delight to your apps. In this session, you’ll learn the principles behind custom refresh controls and transitions, and how to make your app stand out from the crowd.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 204: Custom Controls 2
author: Sam Davies
overview: Having created a great looking control in part 1, you’ll be wondering how you can make it fully interactive, embracing the unique opportunity that touch-based devices offer. You’ll start out by creating a custom gesture recognizer, before stepping back to a more technical level and discovering how to use iOS frameworks to make a reusable, distributable package that you can share with all your friends!

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 203: Custom Controls 1
author: Mic Pringle
overview: Ever wonder how the controls provided by UIKit are engineered? Well wonder no more, as this session will walk you through everything you need to know. You’ll learn how to create a unique custom control by compositing existing views and layers, before making it Interface Builder friendly so you can customize the control at design time and have it appear exactly as it would at run time.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 201: iOS Design Patterns in Swift
author: Joshua Greene
overview: Tired of reinventing the wheel? In this session, you’ll learn about iOS design patterns: reusable solutions to commonly occurring problems. You’ll also learn new and impressive terms — “loose coupling,” “composition over creation,” “polymorphic design” and more sure to impress your friends and loved ones.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 108: Beginning tvOS TVML Apps
author: Kelvin Lau
overview: You’ve learned how to make tvOS apps using traditional techniques you’re familiar with, but the Apple has provided a second way to make tvOS apps as well: TVML apps. In this session, you’ll learn what this is and how it works as you make a basic TVML app – and although JavaScript isn’t what the typical iOS developer might sign up for, you’ll be pleasantly surprised at the benefits it can offer.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 107: Beginning tvOS Traditional Apps
author: Tammy Coron
overview: Apple TV is finally here! Now all it needs are some apps. Don’t miss out on an opportunity to learn how to create a traditional (native) tvOS app. The sharks are hungry, and this session will help get your hook in the water.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 106: Beginning watchOS 2
author: Audrey Tam
overview: The Apple Watch – ‘nuf said! Learn how to adapt an iOS app with Watch-appropriate layout and UI controls, to create a Watch app you’ll be proud to show of. Warning: both versions of the sample app have been proven by user testing to be highly addictive. ;]

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 105: Beginning Xcode Instruments
author: Vincent Ngo
overview: Have your users ever complained that your app is too slow or crashes all the time? Have you spent hours trying to track down a bug? In this session, you will learn how to use Xcode Instruments to perform analysis and diagnostics to pinpoint exactly where in your code the problem occurs. By incorporating Instruments into your development cycle, you will become a better developer.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 104: Beginning App Search
author: Owen L Brown
overview: Want to increase your app’s exposure and enhance the user’s experience at the same time? Then check out iOS 9’s new App Search APIs. App Search gives you the tools needed to index app content and make it searchable in Spotlight. Also, the look and functionality of Spotlight search results can be customized to better fit the content of the app.

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 102: Beginning iOS
author: Matt Luedke
overview: Time to start developing for iOS! In this session, you’ll build an app from scratch and learn to assemble your user interface with Storyboards and Auto Layout, display large datasets with Collection Views, and fetch images and JSON data from a server. These core skills will help no matter what path your iOS development takes!

title: RWDevCon 2016 Session 101: Beginning Swift
author: Matt Galloway
overview: Swift is Apple’s new programming language. Released in 2014 and open sourced in 2015, it is the new hotness that everyone in the iOS and Mac programming world is talking about. In this session, you’ll take a tour of the language right from the basics. At the end you’ll be comfortable reading and writing Swift, and will be ready for the rest of the conference!

author: Colin Eberhardt
overview: In this tutorial, you will implement your very own custom control. You’ll touch on such concepts as extending existing controls, designing and implementing your control’s API, and even how to share your new control with the development community.

title: Photoshop Tutorial For Developers: Creating a Custom UISlider
author: Tope Abayomi
overview: Want to brush up your Photoshop skills? In this Photoshop for Developers tutorial, you’ll learn how to create your own graphics to customize a UISlider, and then integrate them into your app!

title: Join the raywenderlich.com Technical Editing Team!
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: If you are an advanced-level iOS developer looking for a way to get more involved in the community, consider applying to become a technical editor for raywenderlich.com. Read this post to find out how to apply!

title: Apple Push Notification Services in iOS 6 Tutorial: Part 2/2
author: Ali Hafizji
overview: In this second and final part of the Apple Push Notification tutorial series, you’ll learn how to make a simple app using APNS, and a simple PHP web service to power it.

title: Apple Push Notification Services in iOS 6 Tutorial: Part 1/2
author: Ali Hafizji
overview: In this 2-part tutorial series, you’ll make a simple app that uses Apple Push Notification Services. In this first part, you’ll learn how to configure your app to receive push notifications and receive a test message.

title: Readers’ App Reviews – May 2013
author: Ryan Poolos
overview: Check out some great app reviews of apps made by readers of raywenderlich.com – including an app to disguise yourself, a great github client, and more!

title: Overview of iOS Crash Reporting Tools: Part 2/2
author: Cesare Rocchi
overview: In this second part of a series on iOS Crash Reporting Tools, you’ll learn how to get started with 5 of the most popular services: Crashlytics, Crittercism, Bugsense, TestFlight and HockeyApp.

title: Overview of iOS Crash Reporting Tools: Part 1/2
author: Cesare Rocchi
overview: Learn how crash reporting works on iOS, how to automatically get and diagnose crash logs, and which crash reporting tool is best for you.

title: How To Create A Game Like Tiny Wings with Cocos2D 2.X Part 2
author: Ali Hafizji
overview: In this second part of this Tiny Wings tutorial series, you’ll learn how to add the main character to the game, and use Box2D to simulate his movement.

title: How To Create A Game Like Tiny Wings with Cocos2D 2.X Part 1
author: Ali Hafizji
overview: Learn how to create a game like Tiny Wings with Cocos2D 2.X in this tutorial series – including dynamic terrain generation and game physics!

title: How To Create Dynamic Textures with CCRenderTexture in Cocos2D 2.X
author: Ali Hafizji
overview: Learn how to create dynamic textures similar to the hills in Tiny Wings using CCRenderTexture in this Cocos2D 2.X Tutorial.

title: NSRegularExpression Tutorial and Cheat Sheet
author: Soheil Azarpour
overview: A NSRegularExpression tutorial that shows you how to search, replace, and validate data in your app. Includes a handy NSRegularExpression cheat sheet PDF!

title: Cocos2D-X Tutorial for iOS and Android: Space Game
author: Jean-Yves Mengant
overview: In this Cocos2D-X tutorial, you will learn how to build a space game similar to the one was built in the

title: Cocos2D-X Tutorial for iOS and Android: Getting Started
author: Jean-Yves Mengant
overview: In this Cocos2D-X tutorial, you’ll learn how to use Cocos2D-X and C++ to produce a cross-platform “Hello World” app that will run under both iOS and Android.

title: Texture Packer Tutorial: How to Create and Optimize Sprite Sheets
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: This Texture Packer tutorial will show you how to use Texture Packer to create and optimize sprite sheets in your games, using a Cocos2D 2.X game as an example.

title: Create Your Own Level Editor: Part 3/3
author: Barbara Reichart
overview: In this last portion of the tutorial, you’ll add the ability to delete objects, move them around, complete the level save and reset mechanism, and implement multiple level handling to round out your level editor!

title: Create Your Own Level Editor: Part 2/3
author: Barbara Reichart
overview: In this second part of the tutorial, you will implement a portion of the editing capabilities of your level editor. You’ll work through adding popup menus, dynamically positioning and sizing your objects on screen, and much more.

title: Create Your Own Level Editor: Part 1/3
author: Barbara Reichart
overview: In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to make a level editor for the Cut the Rope clone that was previously covered on this site.  Using the level editor you can easily make new levels. All you have to do is drag and drop the ropes and pineapples to where you like them.

title: AVFoundation Tutorial: Adding Overlays and Animations to Videos
author: Abdul Azeem Khan
overview: AVFoundation is the framework in iOS that lets you perform video editing. Add overlays and animations to your videos in this AVFoundation tutorial!

title: Background Modes in iOS Tutorial
author: Gustavo Ambrozio
overview: Beginning with iOS 4, you can design your apps to stay suspended in memory when users push the home button. Even though the app is in memory, its operations are paused until the user starts it again. Or are they? Of course there are exceptions to this rule! In certain situations, the app can still […]

title: Objectively Speaking 2: A Crash Course in Objective-C for iOS 6
author: Linda Burke
overview: This is the 2nd post by iOS Tutorial Team Member Linda Burke, an indie iOS developer and the founder of canApps. If you are a software developer skilled in another platform, but want to start learning iPhone development (and hence Objective-C) – this is the tutorial series for you! This tutorial picks up where the […]

title: Trigonometry for Game Programming: Part 2/2
author: Matthijs Hollemans
overview: In this second and final part of the series, you will learn more about sine and cosine and see some other useful ways to put the power of trig to work in your games.

title: Trigonometry for Game Programming: Part 1/2
author: Matthijs Hollemans
overview: Learn Trigonometry for Game Programming in this 2-part tutorial series, where you’ll learn the theory and then practice by making a space shooter game!

title: PhoneGap Tutorial: A Cross-Platform Zombie App
author: Dani Arnaout
overview: PhoneGap is a mobile development framework that allows developers to build applications for a variety of mobile platforms, using familiar web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: Readers’ App Reviews – April 2013
author: Ryan Poolos
overview: Just because Apple didn’t announce anything this month, that didn’t stop you guys! There were a ton of apps submitted this month. Keep reading for some app reviews for awesome apps made by your fellow readers!

title: Arduino Tutorial for Complete Beginners: Using a Button
author: Evan Stoddard
overview: This tutorial is for those who want to learn more about how electronics (like buttons) work. You’ll use an open-source micro-controller called the Arduino to make a LED light turn on and off.

title: Core Graphics Tutorial: Curves and Layers
author: Brian Moakley
overview: In this tutorial, you will learn the Core Graphics drawing model and how it dictates the order in the order that you draw your shapes.  You’ll also learn how to draw Quadratic and Bezier curves as well as applying transforms to existing shapes.  Finally, you’ll use Core Graphics layers to clone your drawings with the ease and style of a James Bond super-villian.

title: Core Graphics Tutorial: Patterns
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: In this Core Graphics tutorial, you’re going to learn how to recreate a “grip” background pattern that is popular in many apps today. You know you’ve seen it out there – and you must admit, it looks pretty cool!

title: Core Graphics Tutorial: Glossy Buttons
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: In this Core Graphics tutorial, you’re going to tackle a different practical example – how to customize a UIButton.  In the process, you’ll learn how to draw rounded rects, how to easily tint your Core Graphics drawings, and reinforce some of the concepts you’ve already covered.

title: Core Graphics Tutorial: Arcs and Paths
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: In this article, you’ll finally finish up your table view by adding the footer, and adding some finishing touches. You’ll also learn about drawing arcs and working more with clipping and paths along the way!

title: Core Graphics Tutorial: Shadows and Gloss
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: In this article, you’ll move on to customizing the header for the table. Along the way, you’ll solidify some of your existing knowledge, and learn how to draw shadows and gloss effects!

title: Core Graphics Tutorial: Lines, Rectangles, and Gradients
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: This Core Graphics tutorial series is going to take the mystery out of Core Graphics and present it step by step in a series of practical exercises, starting by beautifying a table view with Core Graphics!

title: How To Make a Letter / Word Game with UIKit: Part 3/3
author: Marin Todorov
overview: This third and final part of the series will be the most fun of them all! In this part, you’re going to be adding a lot of cool and fun features

title: How To Make a Letter / Word Game with UIKit: Part 2/3
author: Marin Todorov
overview: In this second part of the tutorial series, you’ll aim for developing a fully playable version of the game. When you’re finished, the user will be able to drag the tiles and drop them on the correct targets, where they will “stick” to the spot.

title: How To Make a Letter / Word Game with UIKit: Part 1/3
author: Marin Todorov
overview: This 3-part tutorial series will guide you through the process of building a board game for the iPad, where you create words with letters. You’ll also learn about best practices for creating solid, modular iOS apps. And as a bonus, you’ll get a crash course in audio-visual effects with UIKit!

title: How to Create a Slide-Out Navigation Panel
author: Tammy Coron
overview: The slide-out design pattern lets developers add permanent navigation to their apps without taking up valuable screen real estate. In this tutorial, you’ll see that it’s really not as complicated as you might think.

title: Giveaway Results: iOS Game Starter Kit Bundle
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: To celebrate the launch of our two new starter kits, we had a special giveaway – one random winner, and one “most active forum member” winner. Now it’s time to announce the results – keep reading to see who won!

title: Platformer and Beat ‘Em Up Game Starter Kits Now Available – and Giveaway!
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: Starter kits include full source code for games that you can use as starting points for your own projects. Two new starter kits are available to purchase and we are giving away free copies to some of our readers.

title: 25 iOS App Performance Tips & Tricks
author: Marcelo Fabri
overview: This article gathers together 25 tips and tricks that you can use to improve the performance of your apps, in the form of a handy checklist.

title: How To Make a Simple Game with Moai
author: Pawel 'Kender' Maczewski
overview: This is a tutorial for beginner Moak SDK developers, you’ll learn how to create a new animal-feeding game for iOS from scratch. With Moai, you don’t need to fear being locked in to one platform — you can let everyone enjoy the fruits of your labors!

title: Official raywenderlich.com Cookbook Now Available!
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: The Tutorial Team and I are happy to announce our latest and greatest book – the raywenderlich.com cookbook! We gather together some of the most useful and practical recipes we have found “in the trenches” as iOS developers.

title: How To Accept Credit Cards In Your iOS Apps Using Stripe
author: Pietro Rea
overview: In this tutorial, you are going to learn how to accept credit cards in iOS using a service called Stripe, a pain-free, developer-centric way to handle purchases in your apps.

title: iPad for iPhone Developers 101 in iOS 6: Custom Input View Tutorial
author: Ellen Shapiro
overview: This is the third part and final part of a three-part series to help get iPhone Developers up-to-speed with iPad development by focusing on three of the most useful classes: UISplitView, UIPopoverController, and Custom Input Views.

title: iPad for iPhone Developers 101 in iOS 6: UIPopoverController Tutorial
author: Ellen Shapiro
overview: This is the second part of a four-part series to help get iPhone Developers up-to-speed with iPad development by first focusing on three of the most useful classes: UISplitView, UIPopoverController, and Custom Input Views.

title: iPad for iPhone Developers 101 in iOS 6: UISplitView Tutorial
author: Ellen Shapiro
overview: This is the first part of a three-part series to help get iPhone Developers up-to-speed with iPad development by first focusing on three of the most useful classes: UISplitView, UIPopoverController, and Custom Input Views.

title: AFNetworking Crash Course
author: Scott Sherwood
overview: This tutorial will take you through the major components of the AFNeworking framework. Along the way, you’ll build a Weather App that uses feeds from World Weather Online. You’ll start with static weather data, but by the end of the tutorial, the app will be fully connected to live weather feeds.

title: Readers’ App Reviews – March 2013
author: Ryan Poolos
overview: Alright Readers, March is coming in with a lion! We’ve got a ton of great apps created by you! This month we’ve got: a pig hunting game to keep your finger guns hot, some awesome tools to help you stay productive, some very unique game mechanics, a todo list with attitude, and much more!

title: How to Update Your Apps for the 4-Inch iPhone 5 Display
author: Adam Burkepile
overview: The iPhone 5 comes with a gorgeous new screen that has a lot more space for your app’s content. But like in the past with the Retina display, you need to do a little work to gain the benefits of the larger screen. With a little thought and design, your apps can make use of the added space in interesting ways.

title: How to Use Animations and Sprite Sheets in Cocos2D 2.X
author: Tony Dahbura
overview: In this tutorial, you will learn how to create a simple animation of a bear walking in Cocos2D.  You’ll also learn how to make them efficient by using sprite sheets, how to make your bear move in response to touch events, and how to change the direction the bear faces based on where the bear is moving.

title: How to Make an RPG
author: Brandon Trebitowski
overview: In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to use pre-built frameworks to create your own reusable RPG engine. By the time you’re done, you’ll have the groundwork to create the RPG of your dreams!

title: Overlay Images and Overlay Views with MapKit Tutorial
author: Cesare Rocchi
overview: In this tutorial, you create an app for the Six Flags Magic Mountain amusement park using the latest version of MapKit. If you’re a roller coaster fan in the LA area, you’ll be sure to appreciate this app :]

title: How To Make an eBook with iBooks Author Tutorial
author: Greg Pugh
overview: In this iBooks Author tutorial, you’ll learn how to create a book in iBooks Author from scratch – complete with embedded video, interactive quizzes, and more. You’ll see how easy it is, and will be making your own book in no time!

title: How To Make a Cross-Platform Game with Cocos2D Javascript Tutorial: The Platforms
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: So far you have the game code 100% complete, and you have it running on iOS and in debug mode for the web. But what if you want to publish it to the web for real, run it on the Mac, or get it working on the Android? In this tutorial you’ll round it all up and get it fully working everywhere!

title: How To Make a Cross-Platform Game with Cocos2D Javascript Tutorial: Getting Started
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: In this tutorial, you will port the raywenderlich.com classic Ninjas Going Pew-Pew game to Cocos2D-Javascript. I like implementing this game when learning new frameworks because it’s simple, but covers the most important aspects of making a game.

title: Making a Hit Tower Defense Game: A Top App Dev Interview
author: Pablo Ruiz
overview: An interview with Alvaro Azofra, Co-Founder of Ironhide Game Studio, makers of the award winning tower defense game, Kingdom Rush. Keep reading to learn what Alvaro and Ironhide Games did to make Kingdom Rush such a hit – and their advice for what you can do to make a hit of your own!

title: How to Develop an iPad Board Game App: Part 2/2
author: Colin Eberhardt
overview: In this second and final part of the series, you will keep score, add some nice animations, and add a computer opponent. In the end, you’ll have a complete and fun game.

title: Readers’ App Reviews – February 2013
author: Ryan Poolos
overview: Alright readers, you’ve been hard at work developing more awesome apps! This month we’ve got a cool workout app that will help you keep that 2013 resolution, some addictive games including one you can play without looking, a powerful photo meta data organizer, and much more!

title: How to Develop an iPad Board Game App: Part 1/2
author: Colin Eberhardt
overview: In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to create a more laid-back kind of game: the classic board game. Specifically, you will create the time-honoured classic Reversi for the iPad, using plain UIKit.

title: Giveaway Results: iOS 5 and iOS 6 by Tutorials Print Version
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: To celebrate the print version launch, we had a giveaway where two lucky winners would win all 4 massive volumes – the 2-Volume iOS 5 by Tutorials Second Edition Print Version, and the 2-Volume iOS 6 by Tutorials Print Version. Keep reading to find out who the lucky winners are!

title: How to Perform a Lightweight Core Data Migration
author: Scott Gardner
overview: Thanks to the über smart engineers on the Core Data team at Apple, you can use lightweight migrations for an increasing percentage of your migration needs with every new release of iOS and OS X. In this tutorial, you will learn how to successfully perform a lightweight Core Data migration.

title: Print Versions Now Available: iOS 6 by Tutorials and iOS 5 by Tutorials Second Edition!
author: Ray Wenderlich
overview: The Tutorial Team and I are very happy to announce that the print versions for iOS 6 by Tutorials and iOS 5 by Tutorials Second Edition are now available for purchase!

title: Intermediate Debugging with Xcode 4.5
author: Brian Moakley
overview: This is a tutorial for intermediate iOS developers, where you’ll get hands-on experience with some extremely useful debugging techniques.

title: Collisions and Collectables: How To Make a Tile-Based Game with Cocos2D 2.X Part 2
author: Charlie Fulton
overview: In the this part of the tutorial, we’ll cover how to make collidable areas in the map, how to use tile properties, how to make collectable items and modify the map dynamically, and how to make sure your ninja doesn’t overeat.

title: How To Make a Tile-Based Game with Cocos2D 2.X
author: Charlie Fulton
overview: In this 2-part tutorial, you’re going to learn how to make a tile-based game with Cocos2D and the Tiled map editor.  You will do so by creating a simple tile-based game where a ninja explores a desert in search of tasty watermelon things!

title: Core Controls in Mac OS X: Part 2/2
author: Ernesto García
overview: In this final part of the tutorial, you’ll finish off your application, and learn how to use the following controls: sliders, date pickers, push buttons, radio buttons, check boxes, and image views.

title: Core Controls in Mac OS X: Part 1/2
author: Ernesto García
overview: This tutorial will introduce you to some of the more common user interface controls of OS X — the foundation upon which most Mac apps are built. You’ll learn about these controls, as well as the methods and properties you’ll need to understand in order to get up and running as a developer!

title: Learn to Code iOS Apps 4: Making It Beautiful
author: Mike Jaoudi
overview: This tutorial will pick up where the last tutorial left off. Adding custom images to your app will always give it a more polished and professional appearance. Remember, your app is competing with a million others; an app that is intuitive and pleasing to look at is almost as important as intuitive and pleasing code

title: Learn to Code iOS Apps 3: Your First App
author: Mike Jaoudi
overview: In this tutorial, you will create a simple iOS game where you have to tap a button as many times as you can in 30 seconds. Just don’t get too excited and smash your screen by mistake!

title: How to Make Music with Garage Band
author: Mic Pringle
overview: In this quick and easy tutorial, you’ll learn how to use Garage Band to make a simple background music loop that is ready to use in your own apps or projects. While working on this song, you’ll learn the basics of using Garage Band and will be ready to compose music of your own!

title: How to Make a Game Like Jetpack Joyride using LevelHelper, SpriteHelper [Cocos2D 2.X edition] – Part 4
author: Bogdan Vladu
overview: Welcome to the fourth and final instalment of the tutorial series. You’ll continue where you left off by devising a system to track the player’s score as well as adding cute bunnies for bonus points.

title: How to Make a Game Like Jetpack Joyride using LevelHelper, SpriteHelper [Cocos2D 2.X edition] – Part 3
author: Bogdan Vladu
overview: In this part of the series, you’ll make your game fully capable of handling collisions.  In other words, by the end of this part you’ll be able to reward and kill the mouse!

author: Bogdan Vladu

title: Beginning Unity 3D for iOS: Part 2/3
author: Christine Abernathy
overview: In this second tutorial,, you’ll add functionality to enrich the project, including better player movement and better game scenery. You’ll also learn how to use Unity Remote for debugging.

author: Christine Abernathy
overview: A beginning Unity 3D tutorial that shows you how to make a simple game for the iPhone.

author: Ray Wenderlich

author: Ali Hafizji
overview: This is a blog post by iOS Tutorial Team member Ali Hafizji, an iOS and Android developer working at Tavisca Solutions.
